Need work selfies? Here are 5 quick tips for a good professional headshot:

1 Get them taken somewhere you're comfortable
2 Match your brand
3 Consider the design of pages it will be featured on
4 Keep them simple
5 Get multiple takes with and without a plain background
And if you need some "About Me" page inspiration, be sure to check out Alexander Kesler's collection of creative examples https://t.co/qm8l2OdP5E

And selfies aren't just an image. They're part of your personal image and brand. And they matter.

We use someone's personal branding to judge everything from trustworthiness to how skilled someone is. https://t.co/pxPFkG308t
To celebrate the natural self and push back against this trend, Dove released a campaign in 2021 called the "reverse selfie" that included an app that removed and reversed photoshop editing.

Why we take selfies:

â€£ Self-expression
â€£ Self-discovery
â€£ Self-documentation

But research also shows we use them to:

â€£ Cultivate perceptions of ourselves
â€£ Discover new aspects of our appearance,
â€£ Construct and maintain serialized, self-branding narratives.

An estimated 71% of people edit their selfies.

Interestingly, research suggests selfies aren't always positive. When asked in 2019, more than half of all Instagram users surveyed reported that the site had negative effects on their mental health.

In honor of National Selfie Day...ðŸ§µ

"Selfie" was the 2013 Word of the Year https://t.co/AVgPAg21FK
